titles.title: Bipartisan Social Security Reform and Results Commission Act of 2001
To establish a Bipartisan Social Security Reform and Results Commission.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Rules, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Ways and Means
Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 3/15/2001--Introduced. Bipartisan Social Security Reform and Results Commission Act of 2001 - Establishes in the legislative branch a Bipartisan Social Security Reform and Results Commission to make specific recommendations to Congress for reform of the social security system.
